comment.author: 67127882@N07
comment._content: Sir Hugh Dow, GCIE, was the Chairman of the Commission. He had been a member of the Indian Civil Service (ICS) from 1909 until 1947. Sir Frederick Seaford was the chairman of Booker Bros. McConnell Ltd, a major company of sugar producers. Mr Frank Sykes was an agriculturalist and farmer with interests in sisal estates in Tanganyika. The Royal Commission's report was published in 1955.
